elements.label: Treacherous Ground
elements.description: Pits and quags and sudden tumbles. The earth here cannot be trusted. We will need strong hands or clear sight - Forge, or Lantern.

elements.label: Peril-Prowled Forest
elements.description: Long ago, the primal trees marched from sea to sea. Some traces of their reign still survive - like this dense and choking territory of root and thorn. The practicalities of Forge, or the mysteries of Moth, may see us through.

elements.label: The High Passes
elements.description: Bleak and grey-green slopes lift the eye to distant snow-edged sky-straining peaks... it'll be the devil of a job to find anything in there. Forge will sustain us, Winter will shield us.

elements.label: Desolation
elements.description: An immense and tawny furnace barely contained by its horizons. At night, a chilly wilderness of stars. We must go carefully, with Forge to shape our way or Grail to secure us against thirst.

elements.label: A Western Sea
elements.description: Most of these islands are well-known to the Histories, but our destination lies in wild uncharted reaches. We'll need Heart or Forge to survive.

elements.label: A Hidden Door
elements.description: Hidden Doors can be found with Lantern or Knock.

elements.label: A Warded Door
elements.description: An engineer, or an adept, has ensured this door will not open easily. Forge or Knock will defeat it.

elements.label: Younger Sister
elements.description: The Mother of Ants was born among serpents. She has so very many younger sisters. It can be defeated in battle; or it will respond to the Mother's power.

elements.label: Watchers
elements.description: Mortals. Perhaps even ordinary mortals. But quite a number of them. They can be fought, seduced, or deceived.

elements.label: Monks
elements.description: Contemplatives blessed or condemned to service here. They're bound by their curious vows. We can murder them, or deceive them, but they will not be seduced.

elements.label: The Fretful Dead
elements.description: Not all the Dead rest easy. These ones dislike our intrusion. We can prevail against them with Edge; or they may obey one who comes in the name of Winter.

elements.label: Younger Sister
elements.description: The Mother of Ants was born among serpents. She has so very many younger sisters. It can be defeated in battle; or it will respond to the Mother's power.

elements.label: Watchers
elements.description: Mortals. Perhaps even ordinary mortals. But quite a number of them. They can be fought, seduced, or deceived.

elements.label: Monks
elements.description: Contemplatives blessed or condemned to service here. They're bound by their curious vows. We can murder them, or deceive them, but they will not be seduced.

elements.label: The Fretful Dead
elements.description: Not all the Dead rest easy. These ones dislike our intrusion. We can prevail against them with Edge; or they may obey one who comes in the name of Winter.

elements.label: Soucouyants
elements.description: One might mistake them for old women, until they discard their skins. The place is aswarm with them. They are strong as strangling roots, and at least half-Long, but they can be deceived, and they are very wary of light.

elements.label: Long
elements.description: It is very hard to kill anyone who's passed the Tricuspid Door. And here are quite a lot of anyones. But perhaps we can deceive one, or prey upon someone's appetites.

elements.label: Dry Soul Curse
elements.description: We need Heart or Lantern to suppress this curse. Otherwise, it will not keep us from our goal, but it may trouble us later.

elements.label: The Fifth Eye Curse
elements.description: We need Heart or Winter to suppress this curse. Otherwise, it will not keep us from our goal, but it may trouble us later.

elements.label: The Creeping Breath Curse
elements.description: We need Heart or Grail to suppress this curse. Otherwise, it will not keep us from our goal, but it may trouble us later.

elements.label: The Worms in the World
elements.description: We need Lantern or Moth to suppress this curse. Otherwise, it will not keep us from our goal, but it may trouble us later.
